messages.content: Understood. Thank you for the clarification on that!

<@1352654639522123826> another thing to consider here is that the interfaces relation on a device points to a generic kind (DcimInterface). The tab that is shown will show all objects that inherit from that generic, but we will only list the attributes and relationships of kind attribute and parent defined on that generic.

The way to work around that today, is to remove the relationship to the generic and instead create relationships to each individual interface type. Then you could have multiple tabs on the device view for each interface type and you play with the attributes and relationship kinds to determine what you want to see in the table.

The downside is that theres more relations to manage and that there is no single view which would list you all the interfaces.

<@1352654639522123826> 
by default, most attributes Kind and the relationships of Kind `Attribute` and `Parent` will be displayed in a Table 
you can find the details in the docs
- https://docs.infrahub.app/topics/schema#attribute-kinds
- https://docs.infrahub.app/topics/schema#relationship-kinds

messages.content: I guess what I'm wondering is what determines which attributes / properties show up in a table?

What controls which columns are visible in a table? For instance, I've imported all the "base" schemas from the schema-library.

I've created a Network Device, and added some Physical and Virtual interfaces to it. Clicking on the device in question, it has three tabs: Network Device, Artifacts, and Interfaces.

Clicking on Interfaces, it shows all the interfaces I added to the device in question. It looks like by default it shows these columns:

Interface, Kind, Name, Device, Enabled, Status, Role, MTU, Speed, Tags

Is there any way to add another column for "IP Addresses", that would show IP addresses that are attached to an interface, if applicable?

I tried looking in the schema, and saw the "InterfaceLayer3" generic, and it has a relationship back to IpamIPAddress, with an order_weight of 1150. How come this isn't showing up in the Interfaces table?
